tools.name: ZohoDesk_createTicketComment
tools.description: This API adds a comment to a ticket. To include an _@mention_, follow this format: _zsu[@user:{zuid}]zsu_.

tools.name: ZohoDesk_getTicket
tools.description: This API fetches a single ticket from your helpdesk.

tools.name: ZohoDesk_getTicketComment
tools.description: This API fetches a ticket comment from your help desk portal.

include.description: Secondary information related to the comments The allowed values are @mentions@ and @plainText@. In the API request, you can pass @mention@, @plainText@, or both by using commas to separate them.

tools.name: ZohoDesk_getTicketsByAccount

tools.name: ZohoDesk_getTicketsByContact
tools.description: This API lists tickets received from a specific contact.

tools.name: ZohoDesk_getTicketsMetrics
tools.description: This API fetches details related to the response and resolution times of a ticket.

tools.name: ZohoDesk_listOfTickets
tools.description: This API lists a particular number of tickets, based on the limit specified.

status.description: Filter by resolution status of the ticket. You can include multiple values by separating them with a comma

tools.name: ZohoDesk_getThreads
tools.description: This API lists all threads in your helpdesk.

from.description: Index number, starting from which the threads must be fetched

sortBy.description:
Key that sorts the threads by sendDateTime.
If the value of sortBy key is:
  • "sendDateTime" - sorting will be done in ascending order
  • "-sendDateTime " - (prefix the value with a "-") sorting will be done in descending order

Note: If this sortBy key is not specified, the sorting will be done in descending order by default based on sendDateTime.

tools.name: ZohoDesk_draftsReply
tools.description: This API drafts an email reply. The from address in the email must be a from address configured in your help desk portal.

ticketStatus.description: Status of the ticket. Includes the custom statuses configured in your help desk portal.

channel.description: Channel through which the thread originated. Values supported are @FACEBOOK@, @TWITTER@, @EMAIL@ and @FORUMS@ .

to.description: To email ID in the thread, applicable only for @EMAIL@ channel

fromEmailAddress.description: Mandatory parameter for creating an email thread. Applicable for @EMAIL@, @ONLINE_CHAT@, @OFFLINE_CHAT@, @CUSTOMERPORTAL@, and @FORUMS@ channels.

contentType.description: Formatting type of the content. Applicable only for the @EMAIL@ channel. Values supported are @html@ and @plainText@ (default).

isForward.description: Key that returns if the thread was sent as a forward. Applicable only for the @EMAIL@ channel.

respondedIn.description: Time taken by the agent to respond to the customer

tools.name: ZohoDesk_getTicketCommentHistory
tools.description: This API fetches the history of comments recorded on a ticket, including instances of adding and editing the comments.

include.description: Secondary information related to the comments The allowed values are @mentions@ and @plainText@. In the API request, you can pass @mention@, @plainText@, or both by using commas to separate them.

limit.description: Number of comment activities to fetch

from.description: Index number, starting from which the comment activities must be fetched

tools.name: ZohoDesk_getTicketComments
tools.description: This API lists a particular number of comments recorded on a ticket, based on the limit specified.

include.description: Secondary information related to the comments The allowed values are @mentions@ and @plainText@. In the API request, you can pass @mention@, @plainText@, or both by using commas to separate them.

limit.description: Number of comment activities to fetch

from.description: Index number, starting from which the comment activities must be fetched

sortBy.description: Sort by the @commentedTime@ attribute. The default sorting order is ascending. A @-@ prefix denotes descending order of sorting.
